abstract: Shell expects to resume oil production in Nigeria within five to six months after shutting down operations because of militant violence.
snippet: Shell expects to resume oil production in Nigeria within five to six months after shutting down operations because of militant violence.
lead_paragraph: LAGOS, Nigeria, April 4 — A year after being forced to shut more than half of its oil operations in Nigeria because of militant violence, Royal Dutch Shell says that it has reached an agreement with local communities allowing it to return safely to the Niger Delta and that it expects to resume full production within five to six months.

headline.main: Shell Expects Full Output From Nigeria
headline.print_headline: Shell Expects Full Output From Nigeria
